item.title: Fractional charges under the microscope
Fractional charges under the microscope
item.content:encoded:
Fractionalized excitations typically require ultra-clean materials at low temperature and high magnetic field to emerge. Experiments on a simple graphene platform now reveal ideal conditions for the visualization of these fragile collective states.

item.title: Förster valley-orbit coupling and topological lattice of hybrid moiré excitons
Förster valley-orbit coupling and topological lattice of hybrid moiré excitons
item.content:encoded:
In this work, the authors show that the properties of hybrid excitons in moiré superlattices of two-dimensional semiconductors are qualitatively altered by the electron-hole Coulomb exchange of its the intralayer component, enabling their coherent hopping between moiré traps laterally separated over 10 nm and/or across layers.

Emergent Haldane model and photon-valley locking in chiral cavities
Emergent Haldane model and photon-valley locking in chiral cavities
item.content:encoded:
Quantum materials can be engineered using the electromagnetic vacuum fluctuations in a cavity, in a controlled way. The authors show that enhanced quantum fluctuations in a vacuum micro-chiral-cavity can enable the realization of the Haldane model in condensed matter systems, overcoming the challenge of inserting opposite magnetic flux within a solid-state unit cell as required by the model.

item.title: High-resolution tunnelling spectroscopy of fractional quantum Hall states
High-resolution tunnelling spectroscopy of fractional quantum Hall states
item.content:encoded:
Local probes of quantum Hall states are still in their infancy. Now scanning tunnelling measurements were used to extract the energy gap of candidate non-Abelian fractional states, which are found to be encouragingly large for applications.

item.title: No heat flow in charge-neutral graphene
No heat flow in charge-neutral graphene
item.content:encoded:
The ground state of electrons in charge-neutral graphene in a strong magnetic field has not been conclusively identified. Thermal transport measurements narrow down the possible candidates, with evidence that the ground state does not conduct heat.

item.title: A way to cross the Andreev bridge
A way to cross the Andreev bridge
item.content:encoded:
Inducing superconductivity in quantum anomalous Hall insulators is crucial to realize topological superconductors. Now a study shows superconducting correlations in the quantum anomalous Hall state, which can convert electrons on its one-way path into holes.

item.title: Fractionalized electrons in moiré materials
Fractionalized electrons in moiré materials
item.content:encoded:
In the 1980s, the discovery of electron states that fractionalize in the presence of a time-reversal symmetry breaking magnetic field opened up new directions in condensed matter physics. In 2023, evidence has accumulated that a version of these states in which the time-reversal symmetry breaking is spontaneous appears in moiré materials.
